alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 3:16PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Kit Carson County through 400 PM MDT... At 315 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Arriba, or 8 miles west of Flagler, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Torrential rainfall with this storm may rapidly lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Locations impacted include... Flagler and Seibert. This includes Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 391 and 409. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
